results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Revcom Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Top enders
results.creator_credit: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Michael Aitkens
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Mick, a boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and the families they have fled from. Cast includes John Jarratt, Madeleine Blackwell, Bennendine Woods, Donald Dale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Michael Aitkens

results.title: Living inside
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Sadie Benning, at the age of 16, dropped out of high school for three weeks and stayed inside with her camera, TV and a pile of dirty laundry. The result is an introspective work of stop and start edits, grainy images and Benning’s reflective commentary invoking a sense of isolation and sadness as she retreats from the outside world.

results.title: The Judy spots
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The Judy spots’ consists of five short videos featuring a papier-mache puppet called Judy. Clever, witty and extremely dark, each of the vignettes is a social commentary about human emotions and behavior.
The vignettes are: ‘Judy feels sad’, ‘Judy hates her job’, ‘Judy has a nightmare’, ‘Judy goes to the mall’ and ‘Judy gets mad’.

results.brief_description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).

results.title: Winners: Top Kid
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a bright boy - a bit too bright for his own good, as the other kids try to prove by beating him up regularly after school. Then he goes on a quiz show and suddenly fame and fortune are within his reach… until they start to rig the show and Gary has to make a very difficult decision.

Cast includes Emil Minty, Harold Hopkins, Michelle Fawdon and Garry McDonald.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Schultz, Jane Scott, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Bob Ellis

results.title: Winners: Room to Move
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Julia Overton, Richard Mason, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a top runner, coached by her father day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance, but Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed. She rebels and plans a new life for herself, but the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got.

Cast includes Nicole Kidman, Terence Donovan and Alyssa Cook.

results.title: Winners: On Loan
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Bennett, Jane Scott, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Anne Brooksbank
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
At her 14th birthday party Lindy wishes she knew her actual birth date. But only her real parents would know, and they’re both dead. Or so Lindy and her Australian family think until a letter from her natural father arrives. Now she must decide between two families and two futures, between Australia and Vietnam.

Cast includes Marillac Johnston, John Walton and Belinda Giblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Bennett, Jane Scott, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Anne Brooksbank

results.title: More Winners: Boy Soldiers
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Margot McDonald, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Quartier Latin International and Cliff Green
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
In 1910 the Australian Government passed a law requiring all boys aged between 14 and 17 years of age to register for compulsory military training. Between 1911 and 1915, more than 30,000 boys were persecuted for failing to obey this law. This story tells of one such boy, Will Barnes, a 14 year old conscientious objector who refuses to register. After prosecution Will is sentenced to three months training at Fort Queenscliff. At the fort, Will refuses to wear a uniform or to be involved in any type of military training. Will meets a lot of opposition but also wins his share of admirers, for sticking to his beliefs.

Cast includes Tamblyn Lord, Nathan Croft, Bruno Lawrence, Nicholas Bell and Gary Sweet.

results.title: Winners: The Other Facts of Life
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Julia Overton, Sandra Levy, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Morris Gleitzman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

Cast includes Dennis Miller, Anne Grigg, and Ken Talbot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Julia Overton, Sandra Levy, Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, ITC Entertainment, New South Wales Film Corporation and Morris Gleitzman
